images.copyright: Lake Powell on the Colorado River (© Peter Schaefer/Alamy)
images.title: World Water Day
images.caption: World Water Day
images.desc: Lake Powell, which meanders across the Utah-Arizona border, was created when the Glen Canyon Dam was built on the Colorado River in the 1960s. It is one of the two largest reservoirs in the US, alongside its downstream neighbor Lake Mead. Together, they provide water to about 40 million people in seven states, while their respective dams generate crucial hydroelectric power.
